name: Aidan Feldman
description: Web developer by day, dancer by night.

education.school: Oak Park and River Forest High School

coding.title: Consultant
coding.description: Helping the Labs group within New York City's Department of City Planning improve their devops and security practices.

responsibilities.title: Discovery
responsibilities.description: Helped the team identify threats/concerns around their software development, deployment, and operation, as well as the underlying problems and possible solutions for each. Tasks were then prioritized based on the ranking of the corresponding concern.

responsibilities.title: Infrastructure as code
responsibilities.description: Automated the hardening and configuration of their servers, while finding ways to minimize the operational burden.

coding.title: Innovation Specialist (GS-15)
coding.description: Federal employee in the General Services Administration (GSA), working with internal and external government agency partners to modernize technology practices through multiple engagements. Served as a subject matter expert in web development, devops, and open source. Participated and led multiple user research sessions.

responsibilities.title: Frontend Lead
responsibilities.description: Rebuilding the extensive form used for federal employment and contracting background investigations.

responsibilities.title: Technical Lead
responsibilities.description: Helping GSA systems migrate to the cloud by developing reusable components and processes around logging, monitoring, deployment, operating system hardening, automated testing, etc. This helps systems to incorporate operational best practices, while streamlining their security assessments.

Work with GSA’s Office of the Chief Information Officer to ensure 18F is getting the support it needs while maintaining compliance. Regularly negotiate with the GSA Security team to find compromise between security, compliance, and operational efficiency.

responsibilities.title: Project Lead
responsibilities.description: Leading a team to research software security compliance (Authority to Operate, or ATO) processes across the federal government, to understand how they vary across agencies, and how they can be streamlined. Managed budget of $165,000, staff, and project direction, while interacting with Chief Information Officers (CIOs), Chief Information Security Officers (CISOs), the Nation Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), vendors, the White House, and more.

Helped 18F projects achieve FISMA compliance by writing documentation and providing hands-on assistance with improving their application security and completing compliance documentation, while ensuring devops best practices. We were able to reduce the time to ATO from six months to one.
cloud.gov: Helped build a Platform as a Service for the federal government, specifically focusing on reducing friction to adoption. Wrote user documentation, built services, and provided training.
Helped create tooling and community around improving the security compliance process, by encouraging structured compliance data, reuse, and automation.

responsibilities.title: Technical Lead
responsibilities.description: Built a business process automation tool for streamlining purchase approvals, while providing better auditing capabilities.

responsibilities.title: Engineering Facilitator
responsibilities.description: Supervising a team of engineers, providing mentorship, soliciting peer reviews, mediating conflicts, etc.

coding.title: Education Hacker
coding.description: Worked to understand students’ and teachers’ obstacles to using professional software development practices in their classes, and conducted trainings on collaborative coding internationally. Was responsible for the system accepting and processing educational user upgrades, as well as determining best practices for classroom workflows.

coding.title: Software Engineer (Contract)
coding.description: Full-stack web development on the site and APIs, as well as building an open source stats reporting framework.

coding.title: Senior Web Developer
coding.description: As the only full-stack web developer at the small (now defunct) startup, touched all pieces of the blogging application, including social features and integrations of the site, layout templating, navigation, the image processing pipeline, and much of the API, as well as helping guide vision for the product.

Have contributed to many open source projects, including Ansible, Backbone.js, Cloud Foundry, ConcourseCI, Dep (the Go package manager), Docker, Hubot, Jekyll, Packer, Terraform, TravisCI, and Vagrant.

coding.title: Web Developer (Contract)
coding.description: Contractor building content management tools for FoodAndWine.com, as well as promotional micro sites for advertising partners.

teaching.title: Adjunct Faculty
teaching.description: Taught the Startup Systems course, a core class for the Master of Engineering in Computer Science program, which covered web development from HTML to APIs to servers.

teaching.title: Organizer
teaching.description: One of the organizers for the annual EmpireNode/EmpireConf JavaScript conferences.

responsibilities.title: Advanced JavaScript
responsibilities.description: After redesigning the curriculum, taught the Advanced JavaScript course for twelve consecutive semesters, helped students gain an in-depth understanding of the language while teaching best practices for modern front-end development. The course material, which is fully available to the public online, became the showcase class for GitHub’s Education program.

responsibilities.title: Building for Learning
responsibilities.description: Was asked to create and teach an interdisciplinary graduate-level course around building interactive educational tools, while also covering front-end web development. In addition to rapid prototyping of physical and digital learning materials, also brought in experts from the educational technology to give students an understanding of taking projects from concept to product.

teaching.title: Instructor
teaching.description: Designed curriculum and was lead instructor for the NYTech program, which helped seniors and graduate students build practical skills necessary for joining startups based in New York City, such as version control, web development, and resume writing. The culminating project was a class-wide collaboration to build a new site for a non-profit.

teaching.title: Instructor
teaching.description: Taught JavaScript as part of the Front-End + Rails curriculum.

teaching.title: Creator
teaching.description: Created a meetup group to provide mentorship for individuals learning to code. Has grown to over six thousand members across seven states, occurring up to two to three times per week in NYC alone.

projects.title: teachers_pet
projects.description: Command line tool to help teachers use GitHub in their classrooms.

projects.title: Vittle
projects.description: A Chrome extension that shows previews of items on food ordering sites.

projects.title: Advanced JavaScript
projects.description: Interactive slides, course outline and resources for teaching Advanced JS.

projects.title: Backbone-Nested
projects.description: A plugin to make Backbone.js keep track of nested attributes.

projects.title: Coolest Thing All Week
projects.description: Mailing list for people to share the coolest thing they've seen in the past seven days.

projects.title: JSONProxy
projects.description: Simple proxy and client library for doing cross-domain requests.

projects.title: Hacker Hours
projects.description: Free office hours for programming help, running weekly+ since 09/2011.

projects.title: Magickly
projects.description: Image manipulation API as a service/gem.

projects.title: Mongoid-Locker
projects.description: Gem for document-level locking in MongoDB.

projects.title: Stringer
projects.description: Virtual stringed instrument, played with a Kinect.  Third place at NYC Music Hackday 2011.

Getting Started Contributing to Open Source

talks.title: What Developers Want
talks.description: Talk and panelist on how to make APIs developer-friendly.  I did a slow jam.

talks.title: Junior Developer panel
talks.description: Organizer and moderator of panel on how to get your first job as a programmer.

talks.title: Animation with HTML5: An Overview
talks.description: A lightning talk about ways to do animation in HTML5 and CSS3.

talks.title: Plano Real: How Fake Money Saved Brazil
talks.description: A lightning talk about Plano Real, a plan which stabilized the Brazilian economy in the mid-1990's.

talks.title: Ruby Fibers
talks.description: A lightning talk about Ruby Fibers, a feature added in v1.9 that adds "green thread" support.

talks.title: Firesheep!
talks.description: A lightning talk about Firesheep, a Firefox plugin for doing "sidejacking" (a.k.a. breaking into other people's accounts).
